intro: Erigeron nitens, commonly known as the silverleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs that help reduce water loss. Erigeron nitens is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
